title: Cloud Architecture Patterns
content: Common cloud architecture patterns include microservices for scalability, event-driven architecture for loose coupling, and serverless computing for cost optimization. Consider using managed services to reduce operational overhead.

title: Container Orchestration with Kubernetes
content: Kubernetes orchestrates containerized applications with features like automatic scaling, self-healing, and rolling updates. Key concepts include Pods, Services, Deployments, and ConfigMaps for configuration management.

title: CI/CD Pipeline Design
content: Design robust CI/CD pipelines with automated testing, security scanning, and deployment stages. Use tools like GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, or Jenkins. Implement blue-green deployments for zero-downtime releases.

title: Infrastructure as Code
content: Infrastructure as Code (IaC) manages infrastructure using declarative configuration files. Popular tools include Terraform for multi-cloud provisioning, CloudFormation for AWS, and Pulumi for type-safe infrastructure code.

title: Monitoring and Observability
content: Implement comprehensive monitoring with metrics, logs, and traces. Use Prometheus for metrics collection, ELK stack for log aggregation, and distributed tracing tools like Jaeger or OpenTelemetry for request tracking.
